title: FX NOTE
content: All commands with the suffix /fx scrape ForexFactory.com for scheduled news and insights. These events help traders gauge market safety and potential volatility. We do not own any of the data scraped. The website is scraped every 10 minutes to check if MONGOKEY parameters such as Actual, Forecasted, and Predicted have been filled in for each event. These parameters are MONGOKEY indicators for how the market responded to an event which is why we try to scrape them in real time as they appear.

title: FX COMMANDS
content: Forex Factory commands are pretty simple. Every 10 minutes we scrape ForexFactory.com for new information. From there the data is transported to MongoDB refreshing its data set periodically. After that you can use the FX commands to interact with that data. `/fx-high-impact` filters only the highest impact news, `/fx-currency-lookup <currency>` filter by a single currency, and `/fx-pair-lookup <pair>` allows you to filter news by pair. If you need anymore information you can click the title or head of any of the `/fx` commands and it'll take you to the main site!

title: Register
content: Takes: ServerID. The /Register command is used to get a server registered with Misty's Database MongoDB. This must be used before the set announcement command for set announcement to work. This also opens up possibilities for other peristent features and settings in the future.

title: Set Announcement Channel
content: Dictates where Misty will send automated messages (online status, market open announcements, etc.). PLEASE SET THIS to avoid missing important status updates! To use this command you need to have used the /register command *first*. After following those steps all you need to do is provide the ID of your chosen announcement channel and the server ID so we can save it to our database.

title: Risk Calculation
content: Example Usage: /risk-calculation EURUSD | Generates ideal position size based on risk tolerance. Works with majors like EUR/USD, GBP/USD, AUD/USD, USD/CAD, etc. CRITICAL: For this command to work you must type the pair as a single word without a slash inbetween. Any other inputs will cause errors.

title: What is currency trading
content: Currency trading, forex trading, or foreign exchange trading is the buying and selling of currencies on the forex market with the aim of making a profit. It is one of the most actively traded markets in the world, with individuals, corporations, and banks contributing to a daily average trading volume of more than $5 trillion. Unlike shares or commodities, currency trading does not take place on exchanges but directly between two parties, in an over-the-counter (OTC) market. The forex market is run by a global network of banks, spread across four major forex trading centers in different time zones: London, New York, Sydney, and Tokyo. Currency trading works like any other exchange where you are buying one asset using a currency. In the case of forex, the market price tells a trader how much of one currency is required to purchase another. For example, the EUR/USD currency exchange rate shows how many US dollars buy one euro..

title: What is a pip
content: A lot references the smallest available trade size that you can place when trading currency pairs in the foreign exchange market. Currencies are traded in lots, which are batches of currency used to standardize the quantity for forex trades. A standard lot is 100,000 units of currency. There are also smaller sizes available, known as mini lots and micro lots, worth 10,000 and 1000 units respectively. LOT: NUMBER OF UNITS. STANDARD LOT: 100,000. MINI LOT: 10,000. MICRO LOT: 1,000. In the past, spot forex has been traded in lots of 100, 1,000, 10,000 or 100,000 units. Most forex brokers will refer to lots by increments of 1,000 (micro lot). A micro lot represents 1,000 units of any currency. A one-pip movement for a micro lot corresponds with a $0.10 change. For example, if you buy $1,000 against the Japanese yen at a rate of ¥109.00. The exchange rate moves to ¥109.50, which means USD/JPY moved 50 pips. You have made a profit of $5. 50 pips x $0.10 = $5 If the exchange rate falls 50 pips to ¥108.50 you will have a loss of $5.
